Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "the "linkassemblies" task failed for Android Xamarin Forms" (#1521) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @ExzaSolutions on December 27, 2017 8:25_

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description

When the Xamarin Forms Project builds the Android build fails.
The android is set to build to Release,and the linking is set to Sdk Assemblies only.
When it is set to None it builds successfully,but the apk is far too big then.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Nuget Packages to Xamarin Forms Solution
2. Set Android Project To Release and linking to Sdk Assemblies only.
3. Build Solution

### Expected Behavior
Should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
Fails with "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly. System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set

### Basic Information

Events.RelatedBody:
_From @borbmizzet on March 27, 2018 22:38_

### Description
My app was crashing intermittently with a "System.ObjectDisposedException".  I have no idea what was causing it, but it seems to have something to do with an IsEnabled Property binding.  I was never able to trigger it while debugging, so all I have is the crash report from Visual Studio app center.  Sorry for the lack of information.
### Steps to Reproduce

Unknown 

### Expected Behavior
Not crashing
### Actual Behavior
Crashing
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
  - Android: 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 26.1.0.1
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms(.Pages) 2.5.0.280555, Acr.UserDialogs 7.0.1
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Note 5

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Picker.Focus

Picker should keep being able to focus

Picker stops being able to focus

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android Fragment Embedding Doesn't Work When You Rotate The Screen" (#2396) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

If you use a fragment created with `CreateFragment / CreateSupportFragment` - after you rotate the screen, all the content (view) of that fragment will be lost because the empty constructor is called by the Android framework.

### Steps to Reproduce

Checkout this commit https://github.com/cosminstirbu/Xamarin.Forms/commit/65fe6f2b0b38496a32320acdaab38092ff244511

1. Run Embedding.Droid
2. Rotate the screen - notice that everything works as expected
3. Tap on "SHOW EMBEDDED PAGE"
4. [Optionally] Set a breakpoint in EmbeddedSupportFragment parameterless constructor
5. Rotate the screen again and notice that the content is not displayed after the screen rotation

### Expected Behavior

The fragment should maintain it's state after re-creation

### Actual Behavior

The fragment doesn't have a view

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/cosminstirbu/Xamarin.Forms/commit/65fe6f2b0b38496a32320acdaab38092ff244511

I think this is a major blocker in having Embedding feature being widely adopted in traditional Xamarin projects that use platform specific development.

Opened issue "[WPF] StackLayout VerticalOptions = LayoutOptions.End is not working" (#2394) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
In StackLayout, VerticalOptions = LayoutOptions.End is not working
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Edit Xamarin.Forms.Controls/GalleryPages/StackLayoutGallery.cs as below:
```
    var stack = new StackLayout { VerticalOptions = LayoutOptions.End};
```
change to `LayoutOptions.End`
```
Button b1 = new Button { Text = "Boring", HeightRequest = 100, MinimumHeightRequest = 50 };
```
`HeightRequest ` is changed to **100** (make it shorter)
```
Button b4 = new Button { Text = "Meh", HeightRequest = 100, MinimumHeightRequest = 50 };
```
again `HeightRequest ` is changed to **100** (make it shorter)
2. Run the project of Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.WPF, then select StackLayout Gallery - Legacy
3. Check the layout of the StackLayout

### Expected Behavior
Buttons should be bottom-aligned
### Actual Behavior
Buttons are top-aligned
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.Pre3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - WPF:  3.0.pre3

### Screenshots

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122225/38453371-437e2824-3a87-11e8-933c-f23a22538b0d.PNG)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Upgrading to Xamarin.Forms.2.5.1.444934 breaks Android WebView login" (#2393) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Upgrading Xamarin.Forms and Xamarin.Forms.Maps from v.2.5.0.280555 to v.2.5.1.444934 causes WebView issues that prevent user data entry

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run app with WebView login
2. Open NuGet Manager and upgrade from Xamarin.Forms.2.5.0.280555 to Xamarin.Forms.2.5.1.444934
3. Rebuild and run app with WebView login

### Expected Behavior
I normally see a login page served up, and user can enter email address.

### Actual Behavior
With this update to Forms, the login page takes a LOT longer to come up, and then is constantly being refreshed so that users can't bring up the virtual keyboard to enter data.  Debug log is also a mess.

### Basic Information
I updated Xamarin.Forms.Maps with Xamarin.Forms, but I don't think that affects the bug.

- Version with issue: 2.5.1.444934
- Last known good version: 2.5.0.280555
- IDE: VS 2017 v15.6.5
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  Not affected
  - Android: 8.1 (Oreo)
- Android Support Library Version: v8.2.0.16
- Affected Devices: All Android

### Screenshots

See attached debug logs.

### Reproduction Link

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.voterscience.trc (v1.1.1 had issue, but v1.1.2 reverted to 2.5.0.280555 in order to work around problem)
[Xamarin.Forms.2.5.0.280555.log](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1886101/Xamarin.Forms.2.5.0.280555.log)
[Xamarin.Forms.2.5.1.444934.log](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1886102/Xamarin.Forms.2.5.1.444934.log)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Debug Xamarin.Forms Libraries" (#2222) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Sometimes, exceptions and so on go on inside the core Xamarin.Forms libraries. Sometimes these cause bugs and so on. Other times, we get unexpected behavior, or deviant behavior from platform to platform. In order to figure out what is going wrong, and potentially fix the bug inside Xamarin.Forms, or at least provide more information to the Xamarin Forms team we need to be able to step through the Xamarin.Forms code. 

Normally, I would remove the NuGet packages from my solution and bring the projects from the external solution in to my solution. I.e. add all the XF projects like Xamarin.Forms.Core etc. in my solution and and add them as references. However, there are special things that the XF NuGet packages do that I can't replicate. For example, .xaml files trigger Visual Studio to generate code under normal conditions, but the code is not generated when I merely add references to the raw XF projects. Without being able to debug XF code, we can't submit a pull request to fix bugs which we'd like to do.

So, what I am requesting is a tutorial on debugging Xamarin.Forms. Especially for Android. Does your team have a tutorial on how to achieve this? Is there some straight forward way of importing the pdf files from the compiled projects in with the official NuGet packages?

Implicit in this issue is, how are g.cs files generated? How do we set Visual Studio to trigger the generation of these files without the NuGet packages?

This would be **extremely helpful** for anyone trying to document or fix bugs in the XF libraries.

Events.RelatedBody: _From @olivier38070 on April 4, 2018 9:16_ ### Description When I debug an IOS project on a Xamarin Forms solution, when there is exception, the debugger do not stop at exception line the debugger do not display complete exception message exception message exist : I can copy the text on the popup and paste it in text editor. The option in Run, New Exception catch-point + Pause the program + When an exception is thrown are selected. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a Xamarin forms application in the xaml page, add a listview, with image and label. in code behind, load image with RSS feed images run the IOS project on ios device scroll the listview app will crash : see screen shot for code, please do not hesitate to check my github solution note : it is a work in progress, just for me to validate the stability of xamarin tools before working on it on production projects. https://github.com/ormaa/RSS-Reader_IOS-Android ### Expected Behavior The app should stop where the exception occurred the exception popup should display the message and stack trace ### Actual Behavior the app stop in main.cs the popup do not display any message, but a hort part of the message. no stack trace. ### Basic Information Version with issue: visual studio community 7.4.2 build 12 Last known good version: none MACOS High sierra 10.13.3 Xcode 9.3, swift 4.1 I obtain the same error when I run app on IOS simulator, or IOS device iphone 5S IOS 11.3 ### Screenshots ![screen shot 2018-04-04 at 11 01 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8026564/38298735-7bb40dbc-37f8-11e8-8126-e21bb8d2dc3c.png) _Copied from original issue: xamarin/Xamarin.Forms#2242_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "iOS - Running on device fails with MT0000: Unexpected Error" (#3892) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @hallidev on March 23, 2018 23:18_

### Description

When attempting to deploy to an iPhone 7 (iOS 11.2), the app deploys properly to the phone but the Visual Studio debugger detaches immediately after deployment and this error shows in the Output Window:

Launch failed. The app '[AppName].iOS' could not be launched on 'iPhone'. Error: error MT0000: Unexpected error - Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com. Please check the logs for more details.

Note: I replaced my actual app name with [AppName] above.

### Expected Behavior

Deploys to phone and runs app with debugger attached.

### Actual Behavior

Deploys to phone and immediately detaches - app doesn't launch.

### Basic Information

Here is what I think is the relevant stack track from the Xamarin logs:

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[backport][msbuild] Skip reference assemblies passed to mtouch (#3791)" (#3889) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- Fixes issue #3199: Could not AOT the assembly System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll (MT3001)
  (https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3199)
- Test case: https://www.dropbox.com/s/kxt3isgzn74nq35/Issue3199.zip?dl=0


Given a Nuget Package added via the "package reference" mechanism and the said package having netstandard 'lib' **and** 'ref' folders;
MTouch was getting reference assemblies and was trying to AOT them. This resulted in an error as those assemblies are only facades.


'ResolveNuGetPackageAssets' computes the NuGet packages using their json asset file, adds the full assemblies to 'ReferenceCopyLocalPaths' and outputs the resolved references via '_ReferencesFromNuGetPackages'.

This is exactly what "Microsoft.NuGet.Build.Tasks"'s 'ResolveNuGetPackageAssets' target does.
